Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC GSMFR codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC GSMFR speech codec is compliant with GSM06.10-12,30-31 specifications for GSM Full Rate codec promoted by European Telecommunications Standards Institute ( www.etsi.org ) and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions. The USC GSMFR codec supports 16bit narrowband 8000 Hz PCM signal compression and decompression with 20ms frame length at 13000 bps producing 260 bits per frame (bpf).

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC GSMFR codec parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_GSMFR

  • Compression algorithm: Regular Pulse Excitation - Long Term prediction (RPE-LTP)

  • Linkage: USC_GSMFR_Fxns

  • Sampling: 16bit linear 8000 Hz

  • Frame: 20ms

  • Bitrates: 13000 bps (260 bpf)

  • Voice Activity Detection: Uplink and Downlink VAD modes supported

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame type (value): Speech VAD OFF (-1), SID (0), Speech VAD ON (1), Speech in Hangover (2)

  • Standards: ETSI EN 300 961-965, GSM06.10-12, GSM06.30-31
